result.execSummary:
The defendant Tammy Jo Shirleen Stanton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tammy Jo Shirleen Stanton is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tammy Jo Shirleen Stanton was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If revoked, court imposes court costs.

miscConds.notes: Court does not impose court costs as a condition of probation.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall have such assessments, treatment, counseling and programming as DOC deems appropriate. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substance unless prescribed and to be taken only as prescribed. 
Defendant shall submit to random, observed testing for controlled substance upon request of law enforcement, DOC, or designee.

Defendant shall be employed or enrolled in an educational program consistent with her physical abilities and or some combination of work and school.  When school is complete, to be employed consistent with her abilities. If not employed, seeking work at the rate of no less than 3 job applications per week and reporting any results of those applications to her probation officer.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tammy Jo Shirleen Stanton

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Tammy Jo Shirleen Stanton in court.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Tammy Jo Shirleen Stanton.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Per agreement, defendant will plead to Ct 2 and State will move to dismiss Ct 1. State recommends 6 months jail and court costs to be imposed and stayed with 1 year probation with the following conditions: counseling deemed appropriate by DOC, to submit to random UAs,  and to work full time or to seek 3 applications per week and document with DOC. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads guilty. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. Ct 2 is dismiss per agreement. State heard. Attorney Mickelson heard. Defendant heard. Court heard and orders 6 months jail with court costs to be stayed. Court imposes 1 year probation with the following conditions: to have such assessment, treatment, counseling, and programming that DOC deems appropriate, not to possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed and to me taken only as prescribed, to submit to random, observed testing for controlled substances upon request of law enforcement, DOC, or designee, to be employed or enrolled in an educational program consistent with her physical abilities and or some combination of work and school.  And when school is complete, to be employed consistent with her abilities. If not employed, seeking work at the rate of no less than 3 job applications per week and reporting any results of those applications to her probation officer, and to provide a DNA sample.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 6, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant Tammy Jo Shirleen Stanton not in court.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Tammy Jo Shirleen Stanton.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant is currently in Jo Daviess County Jail. Attorney Mickelson is heard and requests a plea and sentencing date. Plea and sentencing date set.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
